original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di la chos nub par gyur pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: 'di la chos nub par gyur pa ni gang lags /
translated: what is the disappearance of phenomena here?

original: bdag gis ni gang bsrung bar bgyi /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis mchog tu dga' ba'i rgyal po dang / 'jam dpal la sogs pa sems dpa' dpe med drug cu dang / byams pa dang / seng ge rab snang la sogs pa bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bdag gis ni gang bsrung bar bgyi / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis mchog tu dga' ba'i rgyal po dang / 'jam dpal la sogs pa sems dpa' dpe med drug cu dang / byams pa dang / seng ge rab snang la sogs pa bskal pa bzang po'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Who is it that I should protect?

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Pramuditarāja, Mañjuśrī, and the other sixty incomparable bodhisattvas, to Maitreya, Siṃhamati, and the other bodhisattva mahāsattvas of the fortunate eon, “Noble sons!

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni chos chos su 'du shes shing chos su rtog ste /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni chos chos su 'du shes shing chos su rtog ste /
translated: Foolish ordinary beings perceive phenomena as phenomena and conceive of phenomena.

original: chos spros par byed do //🔽de dag chos su brtags /
analyzed: chos spros par byed do // de dag chos su brtags /
translated: They proliferate phenomena.

original: chos su spros pas gnyis su ston to //
analyzed: chos su spros pas gnyis su ston to //
translated: Because of their conceptualization of phenomena and their proliferation of phenomena, they teach duality.

original: gang dag gnyis su ston pa de dag chos dang 'gal bar zhugs pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gang dag gnyis su ston pa de dag chos dang 'gal bar zhugs pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Those who teach duality are indeed engaged in conflict with the Dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽gang don dam par na 'di la chos sam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / gang don dam par na 'di la chos sam /
translated: Noble sons!

original: chos dang 'gal ba gang yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos dang 'gal ba gang yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Ultimately, neither phenomena nor conflict with the Dharma are observed here.

original: de nas bcom ldan @399b 'das kyis don de dag bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan @399b 'das kyis don de dag bka' stsal nas /
translated: Then the Bhagavat, having taught this meaning,

original: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //🔽kha cig byas pa de nyid 'dus byas te //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so // kha cig byas pa de nyid 'dus byas te //
translated: at that time spoke these verses:🔽Some say that very creation is creation,

original: gzhan ni 'dus ma byas 'dzer kha cig gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'dus ma byas 'dzer kha cig gzhan //
translated: and others say that creation is uncreated.

original: chos la dmigs pas gnyi ga'ang rnam rtog ste //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pas gnyi ga'ang rnam rtog ste //
translated: Both are conceptualization, because of objectifying phenomena,

original: spros pa de ni dag pa ma yin smra //
analyzed: spros pa de ni dag pa ma yin smra //
translated: and that conceptualization is not pure.

original: chos ni gang gis ma byas bshig pa med //
analyzed: chos ni gang gis ma byas bshig pa med //
translated: Phenomena are not created and are not destroyed,🔽are not seen, are not known, and are not near.

original: ma mthong ma shes su dang nye ba'ang min; ;yongs rtog spyod yul mi rigs ldan de dag /
analyzed: ma mthong ma shes su dang nye ba'ang min; ;yongs rtog spyod yul mi rigs ldan de dag /
translated: Those who have the domain of conceptualization,

original: de dag thams cad stong zhes tshig tu smra //
analyzed: de dag thams cad stong zhes tshig tu smra //
translated: they all say, “Everything is empty.”

original: gang zhig stong sems de ni rigs min te //
analyzed: gang zhig stong sems de ni rigs min te //
translated: Those who have a mind of emptiness are not correct,🔽because they imagine non-arising.

original: 'di ltar de yis skye med brtags phyir ro; ;rnam rtog thams cad bdud kyi zhags pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ltar de yis skye med brtags phyir ro; ;rnam rtog thams cad bdud kyi zhags pa ste //
translated: All conceptualization is the noose of Mara,

original: 'gyur med chos kyi phyag rgya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur med chos kyi phyag rgya zhes bya'o //
translated: but the seal of the immutable Dharma is called “unmoving.”

original: med pa'i chos la yongs su rtog pas na //
analyzed: med pa'i chos la yongs su rtog pas na //
translated: Because of conceptualizing non-existent phenomena,

original: byis pa gang yin g-yo ba de yis bcings //
analyzed: byis pa gang yin g-yo ba de yis bcings //
translated: the childish are bound by that movement.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad brag ca 'dra //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad brag ca 'dra //
translated: All thoughts are like echoes.

original: byis pa de dag gnyis su 'dzin pas rtog /
analyzed: byis pa de dag gnyis su 'dzin pas rtog /
translated: The childish conceive of them dualistically.

original: shes ldan rnams kyis shes pa gzhar mi rnyed //
analyzed: shes ldan rnams kyis shes pa gzhar mi rnyed //
translated: The wise never find consciousness in the knower.🔽Consciousness does not come from the knower.

original: shes ldan las kyang shes pa byung ba med; ;kun rdzob dag la brten nas 'di bstan te //
analyzed: shes ldan las kyang shes pa byung ba med; ;kun rdzob dag la brten nas 'di bstan te //
translated: This is taught in dependence on the conventional,

original: 'di la shes dang shes ldan mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di la shes dang shes ldan mi dmigs so //
translated: But here neither consciousness nor the knower is apprehended.

original: gal te chos kyi ngo bo 'ga' yod na //
analyzed: gal te chos kyi ngo bo 'ga' yod na //
translated: If the essence of phenomena existed,

original: de ni 'jig phyir chad pa mya ngan 'da'//
analyzed: de ni 'jig phyir chad pa mya ngan 'da'//
translated: Then, since it would perish, it would be nirvana.

original: gal te chos rnams gnas par gyur na ni //
analyzed: gal te chos rnams gnas par gyur na ni //
translated: If phenomena were to endure,

original: de tshe mya ngan 'das kun rtag par 'gyur //🔽byis pa dag gis spangs dang de bzhin thob //
analyzed: de tshe mya ngan 'das kun rtag par 'gyur // byis pa dag gis spangs dang de bzhin thob //
translated: Then nirvana would be permanent.🔽The childish abandon and attain.

original: byis pas mya ngan 'da' byas @400a *//
analyzed: byis pas mya ngan 'da' byas @400a *//
translated: The childish think they attain nirvana.

original: mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med //
translated: It has no characteristics.

original: bdag tu dmigs pa dag ni 'dus byas thob //
analyzed: bdag tu dmigs pa dag ni 'dus byas thob //
translated: Those who apprehend a self attain conditioned things.

original: mkhas pa yod dang med par 'du shes med //
analyzed: mkhas pa yod dang med par 'du shes med //
translated: The wise have no conception of existence or nonexistence.

original: rig dang ma rig gnyi ga gnyis su med //
analyzed: rig dang ma rig gnyi ga gnyis su med //
translated: Knowledge and ignorance are neither of the two.

original: tha snyad tsam ste de la snying po med //
analyzed: tha snyad tsam ste de la snying po med //
translated: It is merely a convention, without any essence.

original: spros pa mtshan ma spyod yul de dag ni //
analyzed: spros pa mtshan ma spyod yul de dag ni //
translated: Those who engage in conceptual elaborations and characteristics

original: dngos po gzhig phyir mya ngan 'das pa smra //🔽sems kyis sems kyi ngo bo nyid mi shes //
analyzed: dngos po gzhig phyir mya ngan 'das pa smra // sems kyis sems kyi ngo bo nyid mi shes //
translated: Say that nirvana is the destruction of things.🔽The mind does not know the essence of the mind.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis sems kyang mi shes te //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis sems kyang mi shes te //
translated: The essence itself does not know the mind.

original: chos rnams thams cad rmi lam ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad rmi lam ngo bo nyid //
translated: All phenomena are by nature like a dream.

original: de ni gnyis su bden zhes kha cig smra //
analyzed: de ni gnyis su bden zhes kha cig smra //
translated: Some say that this is truly dual.

original: skye ba'i chos de bden pa ma yin te //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos de bden pa ma yin te //
translated: The phenomena of arising are not true.

original: 'gog pa yang ni cung zad bden ma yin //
analyzed: 'gog pa yang ni cung zad bden ma yin //
translated: Even cessation is not even slightly true.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad skye ba'i chos min te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad skye ba'i chos min te //
translated: All buddhas are not phenomena of arising.

original: de lta'i thabs kyis bden par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: de lta'i thabs kyis bden par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: In that way, through skillful means, they become true.

original: sangs rgyas ye shes cung zad ma rnyed de //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes cung zad ma rnyed de //
translated: The wisdom of the buddhas does not find even the slightest thing.

original: bstan pa'i chos kyang cung zad bstan pa med //
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos kyang cung zad bstan pa med //
translated: There is not even the slightest phenomenon of the teachings to be taught.

original: sus kyang sems can gang yang bkrol ba med //
analyzed: sus kyang sems can gang yang bkrol ba med //
translated: No one has liberated any sentient beings.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas mi skye sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas mi skye sangs rgyas so //
translated: In that way, the buddhas do not arise and are buddhas.

original: gal te 'di ni rang bzhin mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni rang bzhin mya ngan 'das //
translated: If this is nirvana by nature,

original: rgyal ba nyan thos bcas pa de nyid 'gro //
analyzed: rgyal ba nyan thos bcas pa de nyid 'gro //
translated: The Victor and the hearers go to suchness.

original: ther zug chos ni mya ngan 'da' ma yin //
analyzed: ther zug chos ni mya ngan 'da' ma yin //
translated: The Dharma of permanence is not nirvana.

original: spros pa med pa nam yang mkhas mi 'gyur //
analyzed: spros pa med pa nam yang mkhas mi 'gyur //
translated: The absence of conceptual elaboration is never wisdom.

original: gang gis sems can sems can don mi mthong //
analyzed: gang gis sems can sems can don mi mthong //
translated: Those who do not see sentient beings and the welfare of sentient beings

original: de ltar 'jig rten kun rdzob sems can bstan //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten kun rdzob sems can bstan //
translated: In that way, the world is taught to be conventional sentient beings.

original: sems can yang dag ngo bo nyid mthong na //
analyzed: sems can yang dag ngo bo nyid mthong na //

analyzed: gang dag 'di la phung @400b po bden smra dang // kha cig srid 'gog lam ni bden zhes 'dzer //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni de yi rmi lam du // snang ba gsal ba mtha' yas mi zad pa //
translated: The Buddha, in their dreams,🔽Will give the inexhaustible,

analyzed: bsgrub pa 'jug pa'i sgor 'jug sbyin par 'gyur //
translated: The bright, the infinite light.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa //
translated: Then the Lord said to the youthful Mañjuśrī:

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
translated: “Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to fully awaken to the perfect enlightenment of buddhahood should strive in this samādhi.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su sgrub par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par @401a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su sgrub par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par @401a *//
translated: Bodhisattvas who wish to attain the major and minor marks should exert themselves in this samādhi.

original: bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas who wish to attain the eighteen unique qualities of a buddha should exert themselves in this samādhi.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas who wish to attain the strengths, the fearlessnesses, great love, and great compassion should exert themselves in this samādhi.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang / rang byung nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshe phun sum tshogs pa dang / bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang / rang byung nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshe phun sum tshogs pa dang / bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas who wish to attain the buddha eye, self-arising, the perfection of a buddhafield, the perfection of lifespan, and the perfection of display should exert themselves in this samādhi.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' mtshan phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' snang ba dang / ye shes dang / gzungs dang / sems can gyi skad kyi brda dang / rigs pa dang / tshul dang / sgo thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' mtshan phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' snang ba dang / ye shes dang / gzungs dang / sems can gyi skad kyi brda dang / rigs pa dang / tshul dang / sgo thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas who wish to attain an excellent retinue, an excellent form, excellent marks, and the excellence of being a śrāvaka should exert themselves in this samādhi.🔽Bodhisattvas who wish to attain illumination, wisdom, dhāraṇī, the symbolic language of sentient beings, reasoning, methods, and gateways should exert themselves in this samādhi.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lam la 'jug pa dang / 'od phun sum tshogs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / rnam par gdon mi za ba'i stobs bskyed pa la mkhas pa thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lam la 'jug pa dang / 'od phun sum tshogs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / rnam par gdon mi za ba'i stobs bskyed pa la mkhas pa thob par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas who wish to attain the entry to the path, excellent light, the power of correct discrimination, and skill in the power of certainty should exert themselves in this samādhi.”

original: byang chub sems @401b dpa' spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / lta ba phyin ci ma log pa dang / mnyam pa nyid rtogs par khong du chud par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems @401b dpa' spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / lta ba phyin ci ma log pa dang / mnyam pa nyid rtogs par khong du chud par 'dod pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas who wish to have perfect eloquence, an undistorted view, and an understanding of the realization of sameness should apply themselves to this absorption.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson pa ni yon tan gyi phan yon 'di thams cad 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin 'di la brtson pa ni yon tan gyi phan yon 'di thams cad 'thob bo //
translated: Because bodhisattvas who apply themselves to this absorption will attain all these qualities and benefits.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yon tan gyi phan yon dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //🔽'dren pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yon tan gyi phan yon dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas zhes bya'o // 'dren pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas who possess these qualities and benefits are called buddhas.🔽They are called guides.

original: rnam par 'dren pa zhes bya'o //🔽yongs su 'dren pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'dren pa zhes bya'o // yongs su 'dren pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called leaders.

original: ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called teachers.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called omniscient.

original: rgyal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called victors.

original: 'jig rten gyi mgon po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mgon po zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called protectors of the world.

original: rang byung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang byung zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called self-arisen.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called thus-gone.

original: ji ltar smra ba de bzhin byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar smra ba de bzhin byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the one who does as he teaches.

original: mnyam pa med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa dang / mtshungs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the one who is incomparable, the one who is equal to the unequaled, and the one who is without equal.

original: mchog tu smra ba /
analyzed: mchog tu smra ba /
translated: He is called the supreme speaker.

original: yang dag par smra ba /
analyzed: yang dag par smra ba /
translated: He is called the one who speaks correctly.

original: bde ba smra ba /
analyzed: bde ba smra ba /
translated: He is called the one who speaks pleasantly.

original: dus su smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus su smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the one who speaks at the right time.

original: 'dul ba smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the one who speaks the vinaya.

original: bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the unsurpassed.

original: mi'i dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi'i dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the best of humans.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal / nges ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas nas bcom ldan 'das mar me mdzad de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ma thag tu byang chub thob bo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / nges ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas nas bcom ldan 'das mar me mdzad de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ma thag tu byang chub thob bo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, as soon as he saw the Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara, he attained awakening.

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad gzigs ma thag tu byang chub brnyes nas /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad gzigs ma thag tu byang chub brnyes nas /
translated: “If the Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara was seen and awakening was attained,

original: bcom ldan @402a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan @402a *//
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'das / ci'i slad du slar bskal pa grangs ma mchis par 'khor ba na 'khor /
analyzed: 'das / ci'i slad du slar bskal pa grangs ma mchis par 'khor ba na 'khor /
translated: why did he then remain in saṃsāra for countless eons?”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed cing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sngon gyi smon lam phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bskal pa grangs med par 'khor ba na 'khor mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed cing sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sngon gyi smon lam phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bskal pa grangs med par 'khor ba na 'khor mod kyi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, for the sake of performing the activities of a Buddha, and in order to ripen beings and to attain the perfection of former aspirations, I will remain in saṃsāra for countless eons.

original: 'on kyang / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: 'on kyang / 'jam dpal /
translated: However, Mañjuśrī,

original: der ngas byang chub dang / de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: der ngas byang chub dang / de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa bzung ngo //
translated: I will attain enlightenment there, and I will attain parinirvāṇa there.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don 'di nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don 'di nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to teach this very meaning extensively, at that time spoke these verses:

original: 'di dang ldan pa 'dren par 'gyur te blo gros mtha' yas blo gros mchog /
analyzed: 'di dang ldan pa 'dren par 'gyur te blo gros mtha' yas blo gros mchog /
translated: “Endowed with this, one becomes a guide, with infinite intelligence, supreme intelligence.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bye ba phrag brgya mang po dag gis dgongs par 'gyur //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bye ba phrag brgya mang po dag gis dgongs par 'gyur //
translated: Many hundreds of millions of buddhas in the ten directions will consider him.

original: mdo sde brgya yi tshul dag shin tu rab 'byed bsam yas dpag med de //
analyzed: mdo sde brgya yi tshul dag shin tu rab 'byed bsam yas dpag med de //
translated: The inconceivable, immeasurable, and extremely vast analysis of the way of the hundred sūtras

original: mdo sde 'di la rab tu sbyor ba mi zad gzungs 'thob rnyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di la rab tu sbyor ba mi zad gzungs 'thob rnyed par 'gyur //
translated: “Those who apply themselves to this sūtra will attain inexhaustible dhāraṇī.

original: 'di ni ye shes ting 'dzin rnam par gdon mi za ba skad kun sgo //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes ting 'dzin rnam par gdon mi za ba skad kun sgo //
translated: This is the dhāraṇī of the wisdom samādhi that is certain to be the gateway to all languages,

original: rab tu rtogs dang rnam par grol dang chags med 'dzin pa thams cad zhi //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs dang rnam par grol dang chags med 'dzin pa thams cad zhi //
translated: To perfect understanding, liberation, and the pacification of all grasping at attachment,

original: mi skye ba dang 'gog dang gzhi med mya ngan 'das dang rims nad med //
analyzed: mi skye ba dang 'gog dang gzhi med mya ngan 'das dang rims nad med //
translated: To nonarising, cessation, the absence of basis, nirvāṇa, and the absence of disease,

original: stobs dang mtshan dang dpe byad bzang dang rgyal ba'i yon tan kun sgrub pa //
analyzed: stobs dang mtshan dang dpe byad bzang dang rgyal ba'i yon tan kun sgrub pa //
translated: To the attainment of all the qualities of the jinas, such as the strengths, the major marks, and the minor marks,

original: dbyangs kyi yan lag kun dang sna tshogs @402b mtha' yas skad rnams yongs su sbyong //
analyzed: dbyangs kyi yan lag kun dang sna tshogs @402b mtha' yas skad rnams yongs su sbyong //
translated: And to perfecting all the aspects of melodious speech and the infinite varieties of languages.

original: rjes su rtogs dang tshim pa dang ni sbyong dang 'dzin pa thams cad bral //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs dang tshim pa dang ni sbyong dang 'dzin pa thams cad bral //
translated: It is the dhāraṇī of perfect understanding, satisfaction, purification, and the absence of all grasping,

original: shin tu rnam par shes dang gdon mi za mchog nyon mongs thams cad zad //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par shes dang gdon mi za mchog nyon mongs thams cad zad //
translated: Of perfect cognition, certainty, and the exhaustion of all afflictions.

original: mdo sde 'di la rab tu sbyor ba byang chub drung du song ba yin //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di la rab tu sbyor ba byang chub drung du song ba yin //
translated: “Those who apply themselves to this sūtra will go to the seat of awakening.

original: rtse gcig yid kyis mngon sum du na 'di la tshul bzhin rab sbyar la //
analyzed: rtse gcig yid kyis mngon sum du na 'di la tshul bzhin rab sbyar la //
translated: “With a one-pointed mind, one should apply oneself properly to this.

original: gnyid dang le lo ma byed shes kyi khe bde mngon par dga' ma byed //
analyzed: gnyid dang le lo ma byed shes kyi khe bde mngon par dga' ma byed //
translated: Do not sleep or be lazy, but delight in the happiness of wisdom.

original: rtag tu tshul khrims gnyen dang phrag dog med dang byams pa'i yid du byos //
analyzed: rtag tu tshul khrims gnyen dang phrag dog med dang byams pa'i yid du byos //
translated: Always be disciplined, without envy, and have a loving mind.

original: dga' ba'i ngang tshul gus dang bcas pas ting 'dzin mchog 'di rnyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: dga' ba'i ngang tshul gus dang bcas pas ting 'dzin mchog 'di rnyed par 'gyur //
translated: With a joyful disposition and respect, one will attain this supreme samādhi.🔽“With an impartial and very controlled mind, be honest, always joyful,

original: mnyam sems shin tu bsdams pa drang po rtag tu rnam par dga' ba dang // gnas med 'dris med shes kyi khe dang bde la padma chu bzhin byos //
analyzed: mnyam sems shin tu bsdams pa drang po rtag tu rnam par dga' ba dang // gnas med 'dris med shes kyi khe dang bde la padma chu bzhin byos //
translated: and like a lotus, be unstained by the happiness and wealth of wisdom.

original: ji ltar bya bzhin nga med mos pa brtan zhing sred dang g-yo med pa //
analyzed: ji ltar bya bzhin nga med mos pa brtan zhing sred dang g-yo med pa //
translated: “Without attachment, without familiarity, and without self-interest,

original: de ni phyi ma'i dus na gzungs mchog rgyal po 'di ni 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni phyi ma'i dus na gzungs mchog rgyal po 'di ni 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: one will attain this supreme dhāraṇī in the future.

original: stong gsum dag ni rab tu g-yos nas lha brgya sil snyan dkrol bar byed //
analyzed: stong gsum dag ni rab tu g-yos nas lha brgya sil snyan dkrol bar byed //
translated: The trichiliocosm will shake, and hundreds of devas will play musical instruments.

original: nam mkha' las ni byug pa gos dang phye ma dag dang rgyal mtshan brgya //
analyzed: nam mkha' las ni byug pa gos dang phye ma dag dang rgyal mtshan brgya //
translated: From the sky, ointments, clothes, powders, and hundreds of banners,

original: mdzes phreng mgul rgyan rna cha zla gam dung dang rkang gdub do shal brgya //
analyzed: mdzes phreng mgul rgyan rna cha zla gam dung dang rkang gdub do shal brgya //
translated: Beautiful garlands, necklaces, earrings, half-moons, conches, anklets, and strings of pearls,

original: nor bu mu tig dpung rgyan gtsug rgyan sor gdub sna tshogs 'thob bar byed //
analyzed: nor bu mu tig dpung rgyan gtsug rgyan sor gdub sna tshogs 'thob bar byed //
translated: Jewels, pearls, armlets, crowns, and various finger rings are obtained.

original: lha dang lha yi bu mo klu dang dri za 'dab bzang tshogs mang po //🔽nam mkha' @403a *//
analyzed: lha dang lha yi bu mo klu dang dri za 'dab bzang tshogs mang po // nam mkha' @403a *//
translated: Many hosts of gods, godlings, nāgas, gandharvas, and kiṃnaras,🔽Garuḍas, and lords of the asuras, upāsakas, and many hundreds of bhikṣus,

original: lding dang lha min dbang po dge bsnyen dge slong brgya mang dang // de bzhin dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen ma ni mang po dga' 'gyur langs //
analyzed: lding dang lha min dbang po dge bsnyen dge slong brgya mang dang // de bzhin dge slong ma dang dge bsnyen ma ni mang po dga' 'gyur langs //
translated: And likewise many bhikṣuṇīs and upāsikās stand with joy,

original: rang gi gos dag dang ni rgyan rnams phul nas byang chub sems bskyed do //
analyzed: rang gi gos dag dang ni rgyan rnams phul nas byang chub sems bskyed do //
translated: Having offered their own clothes and ornaments, they arouse the mind of awakening.🔽When this Dharma is well taught, it is not possible to measure or demonstrate the many beings who enter into awakening,

original: chos 'di shin tu bstan tshe sems can mang po byang chub zhugs pa dang // kha cig phyir mi ldog par gyur pa bstan cing tshad gzung nus ma yin //
analyzed: chos 'di shin tu bstan tshe sems can mang po byang chub zhugs pa dang // kha cig phyir mi ldog par gyur pa bstan cing tshad gzung nus ma yin //
translated: Or the many who become irreversible.”

original: dgra bcom nyid du btul bar gyur ba mtha' yas gangg'a'i bye ma snyed //
analyzed: dgra bcom nyid du btul bar gyur ba mtha' yas gangg'a'i bye ma snyed //
translated: And the countless arhats, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, who have been tamed.

original: 'dren pa blta phyir zhing ni brgya nas lhags pa de dag dga' nas dong //
analyzed: 'dren pa blta phyir zhing ni brgya nas lhags pa de dag dga' nas dong //
translated: “Go now, O Guide, to the hundreds of realms that have come to see you. Go now, delighting them.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na /
